uk.ac.ncl.jcarlton.networkanalysis.analysis

Class LinkAnalysisTwitter

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.ncl.jcarlton.networkanalysis.analysis.LinkAnalysisTwitter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LinkAnalysis

    public class LinkAnalysisTwitter
extends java.lang.Object
implements LinkAnalysis

    Link Analysis Twitter

    Perform link analysis on a Twitter based data set.

    Both the users that the given user is following checkForLinksFollowing(List) and the users that are following (friends) the given user checkForLinksFriends(List) are processed for consumption.

    Author:
    Jonathan Carlton

        Given a list of user ids, check to see if there are links between the user passed in the creation of the object and the ids in the list.

      • checkForLinksFriends

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,java.lang.Boolean> checkForLinksFriends(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> users)
        Given a list of users, check to see if there are any established links between them and the user passed at the creation of the object.

        A friend, in terms of Twitter, is a user who has a following relationship with another user. user1 follows user2 (user1 is a friend of user2)

        Specified by:
        checkForLinksFriends in interface LinkAnalysis
        Parameters:
        users - list of user ids (long)
        Returns:
        id mapped too true if there is a link, false if not

      • recentActivity

        public org.json.simple.JSONObject recentActivity(java.util.List<java.lang.Long> users)
                                          throws java.io.IOException
        Package the recent activity by the user in question, ready to be processed and stored. This 'recent activity' includes all social media activity such as; the tweets they've liked, an up-to-date snapshot of their timeline, the topics that they've posted about since being last checked and the static users that they've interacted with in the meantime.
        Specified by:
        recentActivity in interface LinkAnalysis
        Parameters:
        users - the static users
        Returns:
        JSONObject of all the most recent social media activity from the user in question.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - thrown from the the fileIO methods that are used in the method.
